abstract_summ: OBJECTIVE The aim of this study is to summarize currently available evidence on vertical transmission of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).Here, we retrospectively analyzed the clinical features, laboratory characteristics, and imaging features of eight pregnant cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection during the pre-partum and post-partum periods.A novel viral respiratory disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), is responsible for an epidemic of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in cases in China and worldwide.BACKGROUND: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV-2) is mainly spread through respiratory droplets or direct contact.This case report describes the clinical course of four live born infants, born to pregnant women with the COVID-19 infection.
title_summ: SARS-CoV-2 is not detectable in the vaginal fluid of women with severe COVID-19 infectionInfants Born to Mothers With a New Coronavirus (COVID-19)Clinical Manifestation and Laboratory Characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 Infection in Pregnant WomenNovel Coronavirus Infection in Newborn Babies Under 28 Days in ChinaSevere Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Infection in Children and Adolescents: A Systematic Review.Vertical Transmission of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2: A Systematic Review.
title_abstract_phrases: SARS-CoV-2 is not detectable in the vaginal fluid of women with severe COVID-19 infectionBACKGROUND: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV-2) is mainly spread through respiratory droplets or direct contact.Infants Born to Mothers With a New Coronavirus (COVID-19)A novel viral respiratory disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), is responsible for an epidemic of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in cases in China and worldwide.This case report describes the clinical course of four live born infants, born to pregnant women with the COVID-19 infection.OBJECTIVE The aim of this study is to summarize currently available evidence on vertical transmission of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).Clinical Manifestation and Laboratory Characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 Infection in Pregnant WomenThe severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) epidemic has become a major challenge to public health in China and other countries, considering its pathogenicity across all age groups.
